allow_cidr_block.description: Specify cidr block that is allowed to access the LoadBalancer

public_subnet_ids.description: List of public subnet ids to place the loadbalancer in

aws_ami.description: The AWS ami id to use

cloudwatch_prefix.description: If you want to avoid cloudwatch collision or you don't want to merge all logs to one log group specify a prefix

custom_userdata.description: Inject extra command in the instance template to be run on boot

depends_id.description: Workaround to wait for the NAT gateway to finish before starting the instances

desired_capacity.description: The desired capacity of the cluster

ecs_config.description: Specify ecs configuration or get it from S3. Example: aws s3 cp s3://some-bucket/ecs.config /etc/ecs/ecs.config

ecs_logging.description: Adding logging option to ECS that the Docker containers can use. It is possible to add fluentd as well

iam_instance_profile_id.description: The id of the instance profile that should be used for the instances

instance_group.description: The name of the instances that you consider as a group

key_name.description: SSH key name to be used

load_balancers.description: The load balancers to couple to the instances. Only used when NOT using ALB

max_size.description: Maximum size of the nodes in the cluster

min_size.description: Minimum size of the nodes in the cluster

private_subnet_ids.description: The list of private subnets to place the instances in

subnet_count.description: Size of the subnet_ids. This needs to be provided because: value of 'count' cannot be computed

subnet_ids.description: List of subnets in which to place the NAT Gateway

availability_zones.description: List of avalibility zones you want. Example: eu-west-1a and eu-west-1b

cidrs.description: List of cidrs, for every avalibility zone you want you need one. Example: 10.0.0.0/24 and 10.0.1.0/24

name.description: Name of the subnet, actual name will be, for example: name_eu-west-1a

vpc_id.description: VPC id to place to subnet into

name.description: Name of the subnet, actual name will be, for example: name_eu-west-1a

vpc_id.description: VPC id to place to subnet into

availability_zones.description: List of avalibility zones you want. Example: eu-west-1a and eu-west-1b

destination_cidr_block.description: Specify all traffic to be routed either trough Internet Gateway or NAT to access the internet

private_subnet_cidrs.description: List of private cidrs, for every avalibility zone you want you need one. Example: 10.0.0.0/24 and 10.0.1.0/24

public_subnet_cidrs.description: List of public cidrs, for every avalibility zone you want you need one. Example: 10.0.0.0/24 and 10.0.1.0/24

availability_zones.description: List of avalibility zones you want. Example: eu-west-1a and eu-west-1b

cloudwatch_prefix.description: If you want to avoid cloudwatch collision or you don't want to merge all logs to one log group specify a prefix

cluster.description: The name of the ECS cluster

custom_userdata.description: Inject extra command in the instance template to be run on boot

desired_capacity.description: The desired capacity of the cluster

ecs_aws_ami.description: The AWS ami id to use for ECS

min_size.description: Minimum size of the nodes in the cluster
